v.v: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
“Should a wise man answer with useless knowledge
Should he reason with unprofitable talk
Indeed, you diminish respect for God;
for your iniquity teaches your mouth;
Your own mouth condemns you, not mine;
Are you the first man that was born?
Have you heard the secret knowledge of God?
What do you know that we do not know?
With us are both the gray-headed and the very aged men
Are the consolations of God too small for you,
Why does your heart carry you away?
so that you turn your spirit against God
What is man that he should be clean?
See, God puts no trust even in his holy ones;
how much less clean is one who is abominable and corrupt,
I will show you; listen to me;
the things that wise men have passed down from their fathers,
These were their ancestors, to whom alone the land was given,
The wicked man twists in pain all his days,
A sound of terrors is in his ears;
He does not think that he will return out of darkness;
He goes to various places for bread, saying, ‘Where is it?’
Distress and anguish make him afraid;
Because he has reached out with his hand against God
this wicked man runs at God with a stiff neck,
This is true, even though he has covered his face with his fat
and has lived in desolate cities;
He will not be rich; his wealth will not last
He will not depart out of darkness;
Let him not trust in useless things, deceiving himself;
It will happen before his time should come to die;
He will drop his unripe grapes like a grapevine;
For the company of godless people will be barren;
They conceive mischief and give birth to iniquity;

v: and fill himself with the east wind?
or with speeches with which he can do no good?
you obstruct devotion to him,
you choose to have the tongue of a crafty man.
indeed, your own lips testify against you.
Were you brought into existence before the hills?
Do you limit wisdom to yourself?
What do you understand that is not also in us?
who are much older than your father.
the words that are gentle toward you?
Why do your eyes flash,
and bring out such words from your mouth?
What is he who is born of a woman that he should be righteous?
indeed, the heavens are not clean in his sight;
a man who drinks iniquity like water!
I will announce to you the things I have seen,
the things that their ancestors did not hide.
and among whom no stranger ever passed.
the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor to suffer.
while he is in prosperity, the destroyer will come upon him.
the sword waits for him.
He knows that the day of darkness is at hand.
they prevail against him, as a king ready for battle.
and has behaved proudly against the Almighty,
with a thick shield.
and gathered fat on his loins,
in houses which no man inhabits now
and which were ready to become heaps.
and his possessions will not spread over the land.
a flame will dry up his stalks;
at the breath of God’s mouth he will go away.
for uselessness will be his reward.
his branch will not be green.
he will cast off his flowers like the olive tree.
fire will consume their tents of bribery.
their womb conceives deceit.”
